class Sum(Tensor): 
1550class Sum(Tensor):
1551    """
1552    A weighted sum of several tensors.
1553    """
1554
1555    def __init__(self, terms: Iterable[Tensor], weights: Optional[Iterable[Number]] = None):
1556        """
1557        A weighted sum of multiple tensors.
1558
1559        Args:
1560            terms: The tensors to add together.
1561            weights: The weights of each tensor in the sum. If not provided, all weights are 1.
1562        """
1563        terms = list(terms)
1564
1565        # Broadcasting means we always upgrade to the super set of edges
1566        self._shape = {}
1567        for e, ts in _group_edges(terms).items():
1568            s = ts[0].shape[e]
1569            if not all(t.shape[e] == s for t in ts):
1570                raise ValueError(f"Edge {e} had different sizes in tensors: {ts}")
1571            self._shape[e] = s
1572
1573        # Any tensors that lacks an edge will be broadcasted to have that edge.
1574        all_edges = self._shape.keys()
1575        self.terms = []
1576        for t in terms:
1577            missing = {e: self._shape[e] for e in all_edges - t.edges}
1578            # Note: don't broadcast if the tensor is already full, since that would create new
1579            # Ones([]) objects after simplification is supposed to have completed.
1580            self.terms.append(t @ Ones(**missing) if missing else t)
1581
1582        self.weights = [1] * len(terms) if weights is None else list(weights)
1583        assert len(terms) == len(self.weights)
1584
1585    def _rename(self, **kwargs: str) -> Tensor:
1586        return Sum([t.rename(**kwargs) for t in self.terms], self.weights)
1587
1588    def _grad(self, x: Variable, new_names: dict[str, str]) -> Tensor:
1589        return Sum([Derivative(t, x, new_names) for t in self.terms], self.weights)
1590
1591    def _substitute(self, x: "Variable", y: "Tensor") -> "Tensor":
1592        return Sum([t.substitute(x, y) for t in self.terms], self.weights)
1593
1594    def _simplify(self, args: dict[str, Any]) -> Tensor:
1595        terms = [t.simplify(args=args) for t in self.terms]
1596
1597        term_counter = Counter()
1598        for w, t in zip(self.weights, terms):
1599            if args["associative_sums"] and isinstance(t, Sum):
1600                for w1, t1 in zip(t.weights, t.terms):
1601                    term_counter[_MatchEdgesKey(t1)] += w * w1
1602            else:
1603                term_counter[_MatchEdgesKey(t)] += w
1604
1605        if args["sum_combine_terms"]:
1606            # Identify tensors with multiplicity and combine them. We use tensor.canon_with_edges to identify tensors.
1607            # It is important that isomorphic tensors with different outer edge labels don't get matched. For example
1608            # (o-i o-<jk) is isomorphic with (o-j o-<ik), but they shouldn't be combined. This example comes up in the
1609            # Hessian of softmax.
1610            ws_tensors = [
1611                (w, key.value)
1612                for key, w in term_counter.items()
1613                if w != 0 and not isinstance(key.value, Zero)
1614            ]
1615        else:
1616            ws_tensors = [(w, key.value) for key, w in term_counter.items()]
1617
1618        # Remove zero tensors or zero weights.
1619        # Note: This won't change the shape of the tensor, since all summands have been broadcasted.
1620        ws_tensors = [(w, t) for w, t in ws_tensors if w != 0 and not isinstance(t, Zero)]
1621        # Base case. Here we can't just return Zero([]), since that would change the signature of the tensor.
1622        if not ws_tensors:
1623            return Zero(**self.shape)
1624        weights, tensors = zip(*ws_tensors)
1625        # If there is just one tensor with weight 1, we don't need LinearComb
1626        if weights == (1,):
1627            return tensors[0]
1628        return Sum(tensors, weights)
1629
1630    def __repr__(self) -> str:
1631        return f"Sum({self.terms}, {self.weights})"
1632
1633    def structural_graph(self) -> tuple[nx.MultiDiGraph, dict[str, int]]:
1634        G = nx.MultiDiGraph()
1635        G.add_node(0, name=self.__class__.__name__, tensor=self)
1636        edges = {}
1637        # Create special "Plus nodes" to collect common edges
1638        for i, e in enumerate(self.edges):
1639            # Note: No need to add the shape here. It's already in the sub-tensors
1640            G.add_node(i + 1, name="Plus Node")
1641            edges[e] = i + 1
1642        for t, w in zip(self.terms, self.weights):
1643            # The weights are a little akward. There a lot of options for how to handle them.
1644            # E.g. the idea of just using a weighted Delta([]) somehow. But this works.
1645            G, t_edges = _add_structural_graph(G, t, root_edge_label=f"Weight {w}")
1646            # Connect tensor edges to the plus nodes
1647            for e, node in t_edges.items():
1648                G.add_edge(node, edges[e])
1649        assert edges.keys() == self.edges
1650        return G, edges
1651
1652    def depends_on(self, x: "Variable") -> bool:
1653        return any(t.depends_on(x) for t in self.terms)
